alert.note: Alert for Hawaii in Hawaii (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 13 at 11:32PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 AM HST MONDAY FOR THE ISLAND OF HAWAII IN HAWAII COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...The island of Hawaii in Hawaii County. * WHEN...Until 230 AM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1131 PM HST, radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain over the north and east slopes of the Big Island. Rain was falling at a rate of 1 to 2 inches per hour. Landslide reported by Hawaii PD SE of Laupahoehoe along highway 19 near mile markers 21 and 22. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hilo, Hawaiian Paradise Park, Kapaau, Honokaa, Laupahoehoe, Ninole, Honomu, Hakalau, Ookala, Pepeekeo, Papaikou, Paauilo, Mountain View, Keaau, Kukuihaele, Kamuela, Hawaiian Acres, Orchidlands Estates, Waipio Valley and Waimanu Valley. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 230 AM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, drainage ditches and low lying areas prone to flooding.
